Service Details: - Provides support, prevention, intervention, treatment, and rehabilitative services, for children, youth, individuals and families in the communities of the Interior Region of BC - Provides a continuum of residential and community-based intervention, support, and treatment programs for families caring for children/youth with special needs, FASD or mental health disorders, or substance misuse, including:- Community intervention and treatment services include alcohol and drug treatment, youth and family support, youth agreement support, and youth justice services- Children and Youth in Care services include Licenced Community Care Facility, child-specific, one-bed staffed facilities, hybrid models (staff-supported foster parent homes), supported 'pods' of satellite therapeutic foster homes and Therapeutic Treatment Foster Care Models- Autism Spectrum Disorder services, include Behavioral Support Program and Behavioural Assessment Support, family-based treatment program, services for families with FASD (or other developmental-behavioural disorders - Personalized Supports Initiative (PSI) services for adults, including Supported Living /Outreach Support, Community Inclusion (Home-Based Skill Development * Community-Based Skill Development * Pre-Employment  Skill Development), and support for families and individuals
Address & Map: 513 Bernard AveKelowna, BCCanada     V1Y 6N9View MapQuest Map
Accessibility: Fully Accessible - Ground level access off of Bernard Ave
